Description: Pottery handle from a bridge-spouted jar. Dark slip with added white painted lines across handle.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Probably found at el-Haraga, but confused with Kahun material. Kemp & Merrillees 1980, Minoan Pottery in Second Millennium Egypt, p. 82 Probably made at Phaistos, Crete. Fitton, J.L., Hughes, M. and Quirke, S. (1998), ‘Northerners at Lahun: Neutron Activation Analysis of Minoan and related pottery in the British Museum’, in S. Quirke (ed.) Lahun Studies, p. 117
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (A550.2)
Kemp & Merrillees 1980 / Minoan Pottery in Second Millennium Egypt (Ka.4) (p. 59)
